import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)

# Input data files are available in the read-only "../input/" directory
# For example, running this (by clicking run or pressing Shift+Enter) will list all files under the input directory

import os
for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/input'):
    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

# You can write up to 20GB to the current directory (/kaggle/working/) that gets preserved as output when you create a version using "Save & Run All"

source.8f05aabd:
import sweetviz
import klib
import seaborn as sns

# Data Visualisation libraries 
%matplotlib inline
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

import cv2
import plotly.express as px
import plotly.graph_objects as go
import plotly.figure_factory as ff
from plotly.subplots import make_subplots
from plotly.offline import init_notebook_mode, iplot
init_notebook_mode(connected=True)

import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings("ignore")

# 3D scatter plot
from mpl_toolkits.mplot3d import Axes3D
from matplotlib import cm
from matplotlib import colors

fig = ff.create_distplot([df['TotalGold'].values.tolist()], group_labels=["R"], colors=["red"])
fig.update_layout(showlegend=False, template="simple_white")
fig.update_layout(title_text="Distribution of Gold Medels")
fig.data[0].marker.line.color = 'rgb(0, 0, 0)'
fig.data[0].marker.line.width = 0.5
fig

source.25a72e1d:
fig = ff.create_distplot([df['TotalGold'].values.tolist(), df['TotalSilver'].values.tolist(), df['TotalBronze'].values.tolist()],
                         group_labels=["Gold", "Silver", "Bronze"],
                         colors=["red", "green", "blue"])
fig.update_layout(title_text="Distribution of Kaggle Gold , Silver & Bronze medels", template="simple_white")
fig.data[0].marker.line.color = 'rgb(0, 0, 0)'
fig.data[0].marker.line.width = 0.5
fig.data[1].marker.line.color = 'rgb(0, 0, 0)'
fig.data[1].marker.line.width = 0.5
fig.data[2].marker.line.color = 'rgb(0, 0, 0)'
fig.data[2].marker.line.width = 0.5
fig

source.0ff798f9:
plt.figure(figsize=(35,35))
r, g, b = df['TotalGold'].values.tolist(), df['TotalSilver'].values.tolist(), df['TotalBronze'].values.tolist()
fig = plt.figure()
axis = fig.add_subplot(1, 1, 1, projection="3d")

axis.scatter(r, g, b,marker=".")
axis.set_xlabel("Gold")
axis.set_ylabel("Silver")
axis.set_zlabel("Bronze")
plt.show()

                         #colors=["red", "green", "blue"]
                )

fig.data[0].marker.line.color = 'rgb(0, 0, 0)'
fig.data[0].marker.line.width = 0.5
fig.data[1].marker.line.color = 'rgb(0, 0, 0)'
fig.data[1].marker.line.width = 0.5
fig.data[2].marker.line.color = 'rgb(0, 0, 0)'
fig.data[2].marker.line.width = 0.5
fig.update_layout(yaxis_title="Medals Counts", xaxis_title="Registration date",
                   template="plotly_white")
fig

Kaggle Notebook User Rankings
Data Analysis & Insights
source.8fe7edbb:
### Observation :-

* User ID created by kaggle in asscending order , Most of kaggle Grandmasters user ID is created early as per Current ranking Vs User ID
* Total Gold Vs Total Silver have positive correlation , Hope there are conversions from Gold to Silver compared to bronze to silver
* Total Votes for Total bronze is clearly positive , Where as Master and Grandmaster kagglers converts the Bronze to Silver and above
